words.definition: A person receiving medical care; able to accept or tolerate delays, problems, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious.
words.example: The patient is recovering. Be patient while you wait.

words.definition: A person who works, especially one employed in a particular field or activity.
words.example: She is a factory worker.

words.definition: Newly received or noteworthy information, especially about recent events.
words.example: Did you hear the news?

words.definition: A procedure intended to establish the quality, performance, or reliability of something; to take measures to check the quality, performance, or reliability of something.
words.example: The math test was hard. Test the new software.

words.definition: A story or event recorded by a camera as a set of moving images and shown in a theater or on television.
words.example: Let's watch a movie tonight.

words.definition: Known for sure; established beyond doubt.
words.example: I am certain about my answer.

words.definition: The direction in which a compass needle normally points; situated in or directed toward the north.
words.example: Canada is north of the United States.

words.definition: An intense feeling of deep affection; to feel deep affection for someone.
words.example: Love is important. I love my family.

words.definition: Belonging to or affecting a particular person rather than anyone else.
words.example: This is my personal opinion.

words.definition: In a straightforward or plain manner.
words.example: Just simply do it.

words.definition: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.
words.example: Technology is changing rapidly.

words.definition: To capture or seize, especially after a chase; the act of catching.
words.example: Catch the ball. That was a great catch.

words.definition: An act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other; to move by lifting your foot and putting it down in a different place.
words.example: Take a step forward. Be careful where you step.

words.definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon 90Â° clockwise from east; situated in or directed toward the south.
words.example: Mexico is south of the United States.

words.definition: Reflexive form of 'you'.
words.example: Take care of yourself.

words.definition: A spoken or written account of something; to give a spoken or written account of something.
words.example: Write a report about the project. Please report the incident.

words.definition: To exert force on someone or something so as to cause movement toward oneself; an act of pulling.
words.example: Pull the door open. Give the rope a pull.

words.definition: The state of something with regard to its appearance, quality, or working order; to have a significant influence on or determine.
words.example: The car is in good condition. The weather will condition our plans.

words.definition: An act of selecting or making a decision when faced with two or more possibilities.
words.example: You have a choice between tea and coffee.

words.definition: Only one; not one of several; unmarried.
words.example: She is a single mother. A single rose.

words.definition: One of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles; to exercise ultimate power or authority over.
words.example: Follow the rules. The king will rule the land.

words.definition: A female child in relation to her parents.
words.example: Their daughter is five years old.

words.definition: The process or activity of running a business, organization, etc.
words.example: She works in the school administration.

words.definition: Situated in or directed toward the south.
words.example: The south entrance is closed.

words.definition: A married man considered in relation to his spouse.
words.example: Her husband is a doctor.

words.definition: The national legislative body of a country, especially that of the US.
words.example: Congress passed a new law.

words.definition: The lower surface of a room, on which one may walk.
words.example: The floor is clean.

words.definition: An organized course of action to achieve a goal; to work in an organized and active way toward a goal.
words.example: He led a successful campaign. They campaign for better schools.

words.definition: The matter from which a thing is or can be made; relating to physical objects rather than the mind or spirit.
words.example: The dress is made of soft material. Material wealth is not everything.

words.definition: All the inhabitants of a particular town, area, or country.
words.example: The population of the city is growing.

words.definition: A deep hole or shaft dug or drilled to obtain water, oil, gas, or brine.
words.example: The village has a water well.

words.definition: A telephone conversation; a cry made as a summons or to attract someone's attention.
words.example: I received a call from my friend.

words.definition: The wealth and resources of a country or region, especially in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services.
words.example: The economy is improving.

words.definition: Relating to the science or practice of medicine.
words.example: He needs medical attention.

words.definition: An institution providing medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for sick or injured people.
words.example: She works at the hospital.

words.definition: A building used for public Christian worship.
words.example: They go to church every Sunday.
